title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement gerard.1787@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Introduction to segtest
text: can obtain offspring genotype frequencies via offspring_gf_2() offspring_gf_3(). two different parameterizations model meiosis. offspring_gf_3(), insert following parameters: tau: Probability quadrivalent formation. beta: Probability double reduction given quadrivalent formation gamma1: Probability AA_aa pairing parent 1 given bivalent formation. applicable p1 = 2. gamma2: Probability AA_aa pairing parent 2 given bivalent formation. applicable p2 = 2. p1: first parent’s genotype. p2: second parent’s genotype. Let’s generate example genotype frequencies. can play around parameter values .  offspring_gf_3() function safer use dependence preferential pairing parameter double reduction rate bounds values offspring_gf_2(), two-parameter model might accidentally choose values impossible. set checks values bounds depend maximum rate double reduction, can vary significantly. Please see Gerard et al. (2024) details.
code: gf <- offspring_gf_3(   tau = 1,    beta = 1/6,    gamma1 = 1/3,   gamma2 = 1/3,    p1 = 1,   p2 = 2) plot(   x = 0:4,   y = gf,   type = "h",   xlab = "Genotype",    ylab = "Frequency",   ylim = c(0, 1))

title: Introduction to segtest
text: ’ll first simulate data null segregation distortion true. LRT large pp-value, appropriate since segregation distortion.
code: set.seed(1) g1 <- 1 g2 <- 2 alpha <- 1/6 xi1 <- 1/3 xi2 <- 1/3 n <- 20 rd <- 10 x <- simf1g(   n = n,    g1 = g1,    g2 = g2,    alpha = alpha,    xi1 = xi1,    xi2 = xi2) gl <- simf1gl(   n = n,    rd = rd,    g1 = g1,   g2 = g2,    alpha = alpha,    xi1 = xi1,   xi2 = xi2) lout <- lrt_men_g4(x = x, g1 = g1, g2 = g2) lout$p_value #> [1] 0.5698342 lout_gl <- lrt_men_gl4(gl = gl, g1 = g1, g2 = g2) lout_gl$p_value #> [1] 0.6369666

title: Introduction to segtest
text: simulate data alternative true, get small pp-value.
code: x <- c(stats::rmultinom(n = 1, size = 20, prob = rep(1/5, 5))) lout <- lrt_men_g4(x = x, g1 = g1, g2 = g2) lout$p_value #> [1] 3.5306e-07

title: Introduction to segtest
text: Gerard D, Thakkar M, & Ferrão LFV (2024). “Tests segregation distortion tetraploid F1 populations.” bioRxiv. doi:10.1101/2024.02.07.579361.

title: Authors and Citation
text: David Gerard. Author, maintainer. Mira Thakkar. Author. NSF DBI 2132247. Funder.           https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=2132247

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gerard D, Thakkar M (2024). segtest: Tests Segregation Distortion Polyploids. R package version 1.0.0, https://github.com/dcgerard/segtest.
code: @Manual{,   title = {segtest: Tests for Segregation Distortion in Polyploids},   author = {David Gerard and Mira Thakkar},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/dcgerard/segtest}, }

what: Tests for Segregation Distortion in Polyploids
title: Tests for Segregation Distortion in Polyploids
text: light version original package, menbayes, contains likelihood ratio approaches. easier maintenance install. See menbayes package Bayesian tests. Provides suite tests segregation distortion F1 polyploid populations (now, just tetraploids). different assumptions meiosis. main functions : lrt_men_g4(): Likelihood ratio test segregation distortion using known genotypes. lrt_men_gl4(): Likelihood ratio test segregation distortion using genotype likelihoods. offspring_gf_2(): Offspring genotype frequencies two parameter model meiosis. offspring_gf_3(): Offspring genotype frequencies three parameter model meiosis. simf1g(): Simulate genotypes F1 population tetraploids. simf1gl(): Simulate genotype likelihoods F1 population tetraploids. also provide functions competing methods, recommend using: polymapr_test(): Test polymapR chisq_g4(): Chi-squared test (accounting double reduction preferential pairing) genotypes known. chisq_gl4(): Chi-squared test (accounting double reduction preferential pairing) using genotype likelihoods. Details methods may found Gerard et al. (2024).

title: Tests for Segregation Distortion in Polyploids
text: can install development version segtest GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("dcgerard/segtest")

text: x Vector observed genotype counts g1 Parent 1's genotype g2 Parent 2's genotype

text: Chi Square statistic p-value

title: Chi Square test when genotypes are known — chisq_g4
text: Mira Thakkar David Gerard

Chi-Sq for GL — chisq_gl4

code: chisq_gl4(gl, g1, g2)

title: Chi-Sq for GL — chisq_gl4
text: gl matrix offspring genotype log-likelihoods. rows index individuals columns index possible genotypes. gl[, k] offspring genotype log-likelihood individual genotype k-1. g1 first parent's genotype g2 second parent's genotype.

title: Chi-Sq for GL — chisq_gl4
text: Mira Thakkar David Gerard

title: Likelihood under three parameter model when genotypes are known — like_gknown_2
text: x vector length 5. x[] count individuals genotype -1. alpha double reduction rate. xi1 preferential pairing parameter parent 1. xi2 preferential pairing parameter parent 2. g1 Parent 1's genotype. g2 Parent 2's genotype. log_p logical. return log likelihood ? pen tiny penalty help numerical stability

title: Likelihood under three parameter model when genotypes are known — like_gknown_3
code: x <- c(1, 4, 5, 3, 1) tau <- 0.5 beta <- 0.1 gamma1 <- 0.5 gamma2 <- 0.3 g1 <- 1 g2 <- 2 like_gknown_3(   x = x,   tau = tau,   beta = beta,   gamma1 = gamma1,   gamma2 = gamma2,   g1 = g1,   g2 = g2) #> [1] -8.180407

what: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
text: run likelihood ratio test using genotypes F1 population tetraploids null Mendelian segregation (accounting double reduction preferential pairing) alternative segregation distortion. genotypes assumed known.

title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
code: lrt_men_g4(   x,   g1,   g2,   drbound = 1/6,   pp = TRUE,   dr = TRUE,   alpha = 0,   xi1 = 1/3,   xi2 = 1/3 )

title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
text: x vector genotype counts. x[] number offspring genotype -1. g1 genotype parent 1. g2 genotype parent 2. drbound maximum rate double reduction. default 1/6 provided, rate complete equational segregation model meiosis. pp logical. account preferential pairing (TRUE) (FALSE)? dr logical. account double reduction (TRUE) (FALSE)? alpha dr = FALSE, known rate double reduction. xi1 pp = FALSE, known preferential pairing parameter parent 1. xi2 pp = FALSE, known preferential pairing parameter parent 2.

title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
text: list following elements statistic log-likelihood ratio test statistic. df degrees freedom. p_value p-value. alpha estimated double reduction rate. xi1 estimated preferential pairing parameter parent 1. xi2 estimated preferential pairing parameter parent 2.

title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
text: offspring genotype combinations impossible given parental gentoypes. impossible genotypes combinations show , return p-value 0, log-likelihood ratio statistic Infinity, missing values return items. impossible genotypes : g1 = 0 && g2 = 0 offspring genotypes 0 possible. g1 = 4 && g2 = 4 offspring genotypes 4 possible. g1 = 0 && g2 = 4 || g1 == 4 && g2 == 0 offspring genotypes 2 possible. g1 = 0 && g2 %% c(1, 2, 3) || g1 = %% c(1, 2, 3) && g2 == 0 offspring genotypes 0, 1, 2 possible. g1 = 4 && g2 %% c(1, 2, 3) || g1 = %% c(1, 2, 3) && g2 == 4 offspring genotypes 2, 3, 4 possible.

title: Likelihood ratio test for segregation distortion with known genotypes — lrt_men_g4
text: g1 = 2 g2 = 2 (), model identified estimates (alpha, xi1, xi2) meaningless. interpret . estimate alpha (double reduction rate) identified long least one parent simplex, parent duplex. However, estimates double reduction rate extremely high variance.

title: Likelihood ratio test using genotype likelihoods. — lrt_men_gl4
text: list following elements statistic log-likelihood ratio test statistic. df degrees freedom. p_value p-value. alpha estimated double reduction rate. xi1 estimated preferential pairing parameter parent 1. xi2 estimated preferential pairing parameter parent 2.

title: Likelihood ratio test using genotype likelihoods. — lrt_men_gl4
text: g1 = 2 g2 = 2 (), model identified estimates (alpha, xi1, xi2) meaningless. interpret . estimate alpha (double reduction rate) identified long least one parent simplex, parent duplex. However, estimates double reduction rate extremely high variance.

title: Generate genotype likelihoods from offspring genotypes. — po_gl
text: genovec Offspring genotypes. genovec[] dosage individual . ploidy Ploidy p1_geno Parent 1 genotype p2_geno Parent 2 genotype rd Read depth. Lower uncertain. seq Sequencing error rate. Higher means uncertain. bias Bias. 1 means bias. od Overdispersion. Typical value like 0.01. Higher means uncertain.

what: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
text: polymapR package tests segregation distortion iterating possible forms disomic polysomic inheritance either parent, tests concordance offspring genotypes using chi-squared test, returns largest p-value. sometimes chooses different p-value based heuristics. also sometimes return NA. type = "segtest", look patterns given parent genotypes, choosing largest p-value. type = "polymapR", return use via heuristics.

title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
code: polymapr_test(x, g1 = NULL, g2 = NULL, type = c("segtest", "polymapR"))

title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
text: x Either vector genotype counts, matrix genotype posteriors rows index individuals columns index genotypes. g1 Parent 1's genotype. g2 Parent 2's genotype. type Either implementation approximates polymapR ("segtest") implementation polymapR ("polymapR"). Note polymapR needs installed type = "polymapR".

title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
text: list following elements: p_value p-value test. bestfit best fit model, using notation checkF1(). frq_invalid frequency invalid genotypes.

title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
text: David Gerard

title: Run segregation distortion tests as implemented in the polymapR package. — polymapr_test
code: g1 <- 0 g2 <- 1 x <- c(4, 16, 0, 0, 0) polymapr_test(x = x, g1 = g1, g2 = g2, type = "segtest") #> $p_value #> [1] 0.007290358 #>  #> $best_fit #> [1] "11_0" #>  #> $frq_invalid #> [1] 0 #>  #> $p_invalid #> [1] 1 #>  # polymapr_test(x = x, g1 = g1, g2 = g2, type = "polymapR")
